edu.rit.LightBikesClient

Class ChatClient

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.rit.LightBikesClient.ChatClient

  • public class ChatClient
extends Object
    ChatClient.java

    Assignment: Final Project

    Class: Rochester Institute of Technology, ISTE-121.01, 2155

    Professor: Michael Floeser

    Creates a client for interacting with chat services to accompany the game. The chat directly integrates with the GUI and is instantiated by the LightBikes class.

    Version:
    2016.04.11.v1
    Author:
    Felice Aprile, Justin W. Flory, Malcolm Jones, Timothy Endersby

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      (package private) class  ChatClient.ReceiveMessages
      Runnable inner class that listens for messages from the chat server.

    • Constructor Detail

      • ChatClient

        public ChatClient(JTextArea chat,
                  JTextField newMsg)
        Creates a new client for chat services.
        Parameters:
        chat - The JTextArea to post new messages from other players to.
        newMsg - The initial message to send to the server.

    • Method Detail

      • connect

        public boolean connect(String host,
                       String username)
        Initial connection to the chat server. This command is to be called by the menu bar item to initialize the chat server connection. This method helps ensure that the client successfully connects to the chat server even when it may not be running.
        Parameters:
        host - The hostname of the chat server.
        username - The desired username to use for chatting.
        Returns:
        True on a successful connection, false otherwise.

      • send

        public void send(String msg)
        Sends a message to the chat server.
        Parameters:
        msg - The message to send.

      • closeSocket

        public void closeSocket()
        Closes the socket connection with the chat server as well as the different datastreams associated with it.
